alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 5:55AM EDT until March 24 at 11:03AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Eagle Creek Above Findlay affecting Hancock County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Eagle Creek Above Findlay. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Eagle Creek will overrun its banks and begin to inundate portions of Fremont and Graceland Avenue. Water will inundate a field near Rosemont Drive. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM EDT Friday the stage was 9.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:00 AM EDT Friday was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 7.2 feet late this morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.6 feet on 02/18/2022. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1115 AM EDT.
